root: ^Stress is something we all have to deal with, but how you handle it can make all the difference. What do you do when you’re stressed?

s: ^I go for a walk or exercise to clear my mind.
^I bottle it up. There’s not much else I can do.
^I talk to my friends or family.

Exercise: ^That’s a great way to relieve stress. Physical activity can really help you manage your emotions.
^"Here’s a challenge: next time you’re stressed, try adding a new form of exercise, like stretching or yoga. How do you think that might help you?"

s: ^I think it could help me stay even more relaxed.
^I’m not sure if it will make much difference.

c-0: ^Teacher: "Absolutely. Finding new ways to stay calm and focused can be very empowering."
c-1: ^Teacher: "It might surprise you. Sometimes the smallest changes make the biggest impact."

Bottle_It_Up: ^Bottling things up can be dangerous in the long run. It’s important to find healthy ways to let that stress out. Have you thought about trying something different?

s: ^I’ve thought about it, but it’s hard to change.
^Not really. I don’t know what else to do.

Hard_To_Change: ^Change is always hard, but it’s worth it. Start with small steps—you’ll get there.
No_Alternatives: ^There are always alternatives. Even something as simple as writing your thoughts down can help. It’s about finding what works for you.
Talk_To_Friends: ^Talking to someone you trust can be one of the best ways to handle stress. I’m glad you have people to support you.
StressReflection_Complete: ^Teacher: "Well done. Taking on challenges, even small ones, builds resilience. You’re on the right path."
